header.author: Joseph Warner
header.title: An Account of Two Stones of Remarkable Shapes and Sizes, Which, for the Space of Six Years, Were Firmly Lodged in the Urethra of a Young Man, and at Length Successfully Cut out from Thence. Addressed to the Royal Society, on Thursday December 13, 1759, at Which Meeting the Stones Themselves, and a Drawing of the Stones, Were Presented to the Fellows of the Society, by Joseph Warner, F. R. S. and Surgeon to Guy's Hospital
